chapter1.title: Chapter 1 Â· Perfume
chapter1.name: TAM DAO
chapter1.quote: "In the quiet temple, find the inner light"

notes.base: Base - Ace of Wands: Amber, Musk, Rosewood

tarotInsight.title: "Tarot Insight"
tarotInsight.content:
The silence of '4 of Swords' returns to woody coolness.
The abundance of '9 of Cups' hides in sandalwood milkiness.
The call of 'Ace of Wands' melts into skin warmth.
â€”â€” A spiritual journey from seclusion to engagement.

chapter1.atmosphere:
It is not the burning incense, that smoky piety; nor is it new woodenware, with the sharpness of the craftsman. It is more like an ancient temple touched by sunlight and breeze for hundreds of years.
Stepping into the temple: The top note is dry cypress and cedar with a hint of green. Not the vibrant trees in the forest, but wood that has been felled, planed, and weathered, losing its fire. It carries a hint of ascetic coldness, as if you push open a heavy wooden door, the interior is dim, dust dancing in the light columns, the air filled with a secluded tranquility. This is the embodiment of '4 of Swords' â€”â€” a chosen solitude with restorative meaning.

chapter2.title: Chapter 2 Â· Home Fragrance
chapter2.name: FIGUIER

tarotInsight.title: "Healing of Space"
tarotInsight.content:
Make home your sanctuary.
The green and milky scent of fig,
Balances the noise outside and the desire inside.

chapter2.atmosphere: Close your eyes, as if you are in a Mediterranean summer afternoon. Sunlight spills through the broad fig leaves, casting dappled shadows. The air is filled with the fresh scent of sun-warmed leaves and the sweet milky aroma of ripe fruit. This is not just a fragrance, but a switch to instantly relax the soul, taking you back to that carefree afternoon.

chapter3.title: Chapter 3 Â· Signature
chapter3.content:
You suit a woody scent with a warm milky feel.
It has the 'keep away' coolness (4 of Swords),
The 'comfortable to be with' warmth (9 of Cups),
And finally leaves a lingering aftertaste (Ace of Wands).

Suggested:
1. Diptyque Tam Dao
2. Le Labo Santal 33
3. Aesop Hwyl
